conclusion: Calculate the Ampere force on the entire wire frame in a uniform magnetic field.
Ampere force formula: F = I * L * B * sin(theta).
Straight part of the wire is perpendicular to the magnetic field.
Force on the straight part is given as F.
For semi-circular part, consider force on each infinitesimal segment.
Force on small segment dL: dF = I * dL * B * sin(theta).
In semi-circle, current direction changes, magnetic field is perpendicular to plane.
Horizontal components of forces on semi-circle cancel out due to symmetry.
Vertical component of force on each segment: dF_vertical = I * B * dL * sin(theta).
Total vertical force on semi-circle: F_semi-circle = integral from 0 to pi of I * B * r * dtheta * sin(theta).
Evaluate integral: F_semi-circle = I * B * r * integral from 0 to pi of sin(theta) dtheta.
Integral of sin(theta) from 0 to pi is 2, so F_semi-circle = 2 * I * B * r.
Total force on wire frame: F_total = F + F_semi-circle = F + 2 * I * B * r.
Final answer: Magnitude of Ampere force on entire wire frame is F_total = F + 2 * I * B * r.
